text.section:
There are three types of courts-martial:
a general court-martial;
a special court-martial; and
a summary court-martial.

section.section: In a case of absence without leave, an offender shall be referred to a summary court officer for trial without first being referred to an investigating officer.
A member of a force organized under this title is in the actual service of the State and is subject to all military laws, orders, and regulations.
A violation of a military law, order, or regulation is an offense against the State and is punishable as provided in this subtitle.
The jurisdiction of a court-martial established under this subtitle is presumed to be correct.
A person alleging lack of jurisdiction in an action or proceeding has the burden of proving lack of jurisdiction.
